Stefanović: Zapad za povratak opozicije u institucije, ali ne shvata da institucija nema

05 Nov 2019, 17:25

Jedan od lidera Saveza za Srbiju (SzS) i zamenik predsednika Stranke slobode i pravde (SSP) Borko Stefanović izjavio je danas da je specijalni izaslanik SAD za Zapadni Balkan Metju Palmer na sastanku sa opozicijom poručio da je dijalog vlasti i opozicije u Srbiji neophodan, te da je potrebno vratiti se u institucije.Stefanović je u emisiji Pravi ugao naveo da je jasno da je stav Zapada da opozicija treba kroz institucije sistema da se bori, ali da Zapad ne shvata da u Srbiji nema institucija.Naveo je da jedan od razloga za takve stavove može da bude to da je Zapad svestan šta se dešava u Srbiji, ali im je potrebno da vlast bude stabilnija kako bi rešila kosovsko pitanje."Ne zanima ih suštinski to što ne možete da izrazite mišljenje u parlamentu, što imate medije gde nijedan lider opozicije nije bio preko četiri godine", rekao je Stefanović.Naveo je da je neophodno da se prihvate sve preporuke ekspertskog tima protesta Jedan od pet miliona, kao i da se one sprovedu devet meseci pre izbora i uz jasne garancije.On je ocenio i da je "besmislica" tvrdnja da je Stranka slobode i pravde za zamrznuti konflikt na Kosovu."Mi ne možemo i nećemo priznati nezavisnost Kosova", rekao je Stefanović i dodao da Srbija kada bi priznala Kosovo ne bi bila država u, kako je rekao, klasičnom smislu.

Stefanovic: West for returning opposition to institutions, but does not realize that there is no institution

05 Nov 2019, 16:25

One of the leaders of the Alliance for Serbia (SzS) and deputy chairman of the Freedom and Justice Party (SAA), Borko Stefanovic, said today that US Special Envoy for the Western Balkans Matthew Palmer said at a meeting with the opposition that dialogue between the authorities and the opposition in Serbia was necessary, and that he should return to the institutions.Stefanovic said in the program Pravni angle that it was clear that the West's position was that the opposition should fight through the institutions of the system, but that the West did not realize that there were no institutions in Serbia. He said that one of the reasons for such views may be that the West is aware of what is happening in Serbia, but they need the government to be more stable in order to resolve the Kosovo issue. "They are not essentially interested in the fact that you cannot express an opinion in parliament, that you have media where no one leader of the opposition has not been for over four years, "said Stefanovic. He said that it was necessary to accept all the recommendations of the expert team of protests. One in five million, as well as to implement them nine m months before the election and with clear guarantees.He also assessed that the claim that the Party of Freedom and Justice was a frozen conflict in Kosovo was "nonsense." We cannot and will not recognize Kosovo's independence, "Stefanovic said, adding that Serbia would recognized Kosovo would not be a state, as he said, in the classical sense.
